uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.content

Interface Labeller<T,R>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of input object
    R - type of return object.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Targetted<R>

    public interface Labeller<T,R>
extends Targetted<R>
    A Labeller is a class that maps values used to classify plot/table data into groups onto s string that should be used to label the group. These can support many to one mappings so classes that use this should combine data that maps to the same label.
    Author:
    spb
    See Also:
    Transform

      • Methods inherited from interface uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.Targetted

        getTarget

    • Method Detail

      • getLabel

        R getLabel(AppContext conn,
         T key)
        generate the label. Normally this just returns a String but if a non-string object is returned then the toString method is used to generate the label. This is to allow labels with a different sort-order from their string representation
        Parameters:
        conn - AppContext
        key - value to be labelled
        Returns:
        label object.

        Returns:
